channel.title: Marine Mania 2 on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Marine Mania 2 on ZooBerry

item.title: Albino Animal Variant Pack
item.description: Three great albino animal variants for your zoo.

item.title: Albino Manta Ray
item.description: A nice albino manta ray variant for your zoo, created by Zoo Tycoon Rocks.

item.title: Lemon Shark
item.description: The Lemon Shark features two variations, with the darker variation as the default skin. Requires MM2 to use.

item.title: Abisara Geza Niya Butterfly for MM
item.description: This is a Temperate Forest and Wetlands butterfly, named Abisara geza niya (it has no ‘common’ name). She’s found mostly in the Far and Middle East (Singapore, Malaysia, Afghanistan). She’s brown with a lovely marked back.

item.title: Malachite Butterfly
item.description: A bright green butterfly with shiny copper trimmings, often seen flying over MM waters.

item.title: Mourning Cloak Butterfly
item.description: A butterfly that appears randomly in your zoo, found near rivers and wetlands.

item.title: Rice Paper Butterfly
item.description: A butterfly that appears randomly in your zoo, often seen in forests and grasslands.

item.title: Yellow Clouded Sulphur Butterfly
item.description: A butterfly that appears randomly in your zoo, found worldwide.

item.title: Cross Jellyfish
item.description: This jelly is commonly seen in Monterey Bay during spring and summer, sometimes in large groups.

item.title: Deepwater Trachymedusa
item.description: Benthocodon pedunculata is found in deep water habitats like Monterey Canyon and San Clemente Basin on the West Coast.

item.title: Flower Hat Jellyfish
item.description: This striking and rare jelly has brilliant, multicolored tentacles trailing from a translucent, pinstriped bell.

item.title: Fried Egg Jellyfish
item.description: This jellyfish resembles a fried egg when seen from above.

item.title: Granrojo
item.description: In photographs, it looks like a big red spaceship cruising the ocean depths.

item.title: Lion's Mane Jellyfish
item.description: The lion’s mane jellyfish can be found in the cooler regions of the Atlantic, Pacific, North Sea and Baltic.

item.title: Mauve Stinger
item.description: This species of jellyfish, commonly known as mauve stinger, is widely distributed in all warm and temperate waters.

item.title: Purple-Striped Jellyfish
item.description: Of all the gelatinous creatures visiting Monterey Bay, the purple-striped jelly is certainly among the most recognizable and spectacular.

item.title: Dugong
item.description: The dugong (sometimes refered to as a sea cow) is a mammal- that is, it suckles its young.

item.title: Caribbean Reef Squid
item.description: The Caribbean reef squid is found throughout the Caribbean Sea as well as off the coast of Florida.

item.title: Ribbon Eel
item.description: Ribbon eels are aptly named for their delicate movements, as they swim like a slender ribbon dancing in the water column.

item.title: Common Dolphin
item.description: Common dolphins can be found throughout the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

item.title: Piranha
item.description: These piranhas will form interesting schools in your jungle tanks.

item.title: Bream
item.description: A freshwater fish from various types of waterways in Europe.

item.title: Wahoo Ambient
item.description: The Wahoo is a game fish, found in the open see, and is related to the Marlin and Mackerel.

item.title: Brown Pelican
item.description: A large, colourful Pelican found in South and Central America. Has 2 varients, biome is Reef.
